Description: A complete clear glass perfume bottle with 4 straight sides alternating with 4 concave sides. The concave sides occupy the corners. The neck has a tubular collar and a flattish lip. There is no lid. An inscription is moulded into the glass on one straight side.
Bibliographic references: Adams & Adams 1998 / Kulubnarti II, The Artifactual Remains (p.33, 111)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006, London, BM, Gallery 61, 'Kulubnarti' 2007 9 Mar-3 Sept, Belgium, Musee Royal de Mariemont, 'Pharaons noirs Sur la Piste des Quarante Jours'
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.8.56 (excavation object cat. no.)
